Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two separate pictures: one of a healthy, thriving plant with water and one of a wilting plant without water.
The student can show that plants need water by illustrating the differences in the plant's appearance in each picture.
The student can include a depiction of the sun in the drawings to show that plants also need light to live and grow.
The student can observe and represent patterns by noting differences such as color, size, and health of the plant in both drawings.
The student can label the drawings to indicate which plant has water and which does not have water.
